intro: Senecio lathyroides, commonly known as the blue ice plant, is a succulent perennial native to South Africa. It features fleshy, blue-gray leaves that store water, adapting to arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in full sun and well-draining soil, making it suitable for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for low-maintenance landscaping.
